title: How to Change the Cabin Air Filter in a Toyota

steps.title: Obtain the replacement filter.
steps.content: Obtain the replacement filter . You can buy one at your nearest dealership or you can shop around at an auto parts store or online.

steps.title: Open the glove compartment all the way and remove the screw on the lower right side.
steps.content: Open the glove compartment all the way and remove the screw on the lower right side. Pull the loop from the arm over and off the cylinder where the screw was. [2] X Research source Don't lose the screw. On a Highlander, you may be able to remove the loop without removing the screw, which is below and behind the glove compartment; leave the glove compartment closed while removing the loop, then open it.

steps.title: Squeeze the sides of the glove compartment together and pull to move the tabs past the edges, to the front of the dash.
steps.content: Squeeze the sides of the glove compartment together and pull to move the tabs past the edges, to the front of the dash. Then lift the entire glove compartment off its hinges. [3] X Research source Note that when it is too hard to push, instead of pushing both sides, you might want to try to push against the back of the glove box, while pulling on the front. This works, when squeezing the sides does not.

steps.title: Remove the plastic cover by squeezing the tabs together.
steps.content: Remove the plastic cover by squeezing the tabs together. There are tabs on both sides, but the photo just shows one. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Slide out the old filter by pulling it towards you.
steps.content: Slide out the old filter by pulling it towards you. Keep it facing up so that you don't spill the debris.

steps.title: Insert the new filter.
steps.content: Insert the new filter. The arrow that says UP should be pointing up, facing you, as shown in the photo. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Snap the cover back into place.
steps.content: Snap the cover back into place.

steps.title: Place the glove compartment container back on its hinges and push it in so the tabs snap back behind the dash.
steps.content: Place the glove compartment container back on its hinges and push it in so the tabs snap back behind the dash. You may have to squeeze the sides again, as you did when you took the glove compartment out. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Replace the loop and the screw on the lower right.
steps.content: Replace the loop and the screw on the lower right. [7] X Research source
